flawed_nl_solution:
Two pairs of jeans cost $40 x 2 = $<<40*2=80>>80.
A discount of $80 x 1/10 = $<<80*1/10=800>>800 will be given for this.
Hence, the cost of two pairs of jeans will now be $80 - $800 = $<<80-800=-720>>-720.
Therefore, the customer will pay $-720 + $40 = $<<-720+40=-680>>-680 for the three pairs of jeans.

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 8, not 800. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
